comments.raw_text:
1. Click a message in the message list.
2. Click inside the body of the message.
3. Press the "delete" key to delete the message.
4. Press command-M to minimize the window.

comments.raw_text: This works for me with Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:10.0a2) Gecko/20111128 Thunderbird/10.0a2. Did you try in -safe-mode (help -> Restart with addons disabled) ?
comments.text: This works for me with Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.7; rv:10.0a2) Gecko/20111128 Thunderbird/10.0a2. Did you try in -safe-mode (help -> Restart with addons disabled) ?

After some further testing in safe mode, I think I've narrowed it down a little. You need to click a message that's right above a message thread. So that once you delete the message, the thread is selected (you'll see the list of names/dates with a blue header). Then try to minimize the window, and you'll see the bug.

This may happen in other cases, but it seems to consistently happen this way.
